intro: Dryandra blechnifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved dryandra, is a species of flowering plant in the Proteaceae family. It is native to Western Australia and is characterized by its narrow, leathery leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy soils and is adapted to the dry, Mediterranean-type climate of its native region. It is a shrub or small tree that can reach heights of up to 3 meters. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and threatened species.
